intro: Thesium spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to conserve water, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Thesium spathulatum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
